title: Wildcats drop first of season
text:
Wildcats drop first of season By: Uncredited Report Error 
It took the host Winnipeg Avros extra time on Sunday to hand the Westman Wildcats their first loss of the Manitoba Female Midget Hockey League season. 
Kelsey McHolm scored three goals and set up the other as the Avros (2-3) topped the Wildcats 4-3 in overtime. Kaitlyn Crowe, Haley Wickham and Courtney Ganske scored for Westman (5-1), while Jenna Marshall stopped 28 shots in net. 
On Saturday in St. Adolphe, Crowe netted a pair of markers in Westman’s 6-0 victory over the Eastman Selects (1-2). Mackenzie Roach, Paige Hubbard, McKenzie Meek and Jaedon Cooke supplied the other goals with Kaitlyn Slator earning the shutout. 
Meanwhile, in Shoal Lake on Saturday, Emma Coulter had a goal and an assist as the Yellowhead Chiefs (2-0) shut out the Pembina Valley Hawks 3-0. Hannah Fouillard and Jessi Rampton netted the other goals while Emma Greenwood made 28 stops for the shutout. Halle Oswald made 27 saves for Pembina (1-2).
